sub_title: Managing Director at La’Met Consultancy & AnotherView.Today
summary:
A well networked, culturally aware, and resourceful international transformational leader whose whole career has focussed on the creation, growth, and management of diverse projects over a broad spectrum of national and international organisations. 

Identifying & fulfilling training needs through combined e-learning, coaching, mentoring, and leadership whilst implementing interventions to SMEs, corporations, education, and governments worldwide. 

An experienced and effective strategic thinker and prolific entrepreneur, adept in managing rapid growth who demonstrates a commitment to addressing business and social concerns systemically with an optimistic and forward thinking mindset. 

Key skills
Demonstrated & MBA qualified leader, coach, mentor and influencer
Creating and implementing European accredited higher education courses
Instructional designer within education
International business, bachelor thesis coach and assessor
Detail oriented, flexible, international online and offline team director
Effective written and spoken business communication (Native English)
Comfortable in fast-paced, complex international environments
Natural talent to cooperate with, and present to, all levels within an organization

projects.title: Learning For All - Lifelong Learning Grundtvig Programme
projects.description:
European Commission funded Grundtvig Lifelong Learning Programme project with partners from Turkey and Poland focussing on inclusion education.
The project's aims were to equip parents and educators of students with special needs to better help the students to merge with the rest of society and to overcome any deficiencies of educators. This was achieved through comparison of inclusion education methods found in other European countries and sharing the different methodologies and techniques used. 
A pilot programme was initiated in an elementary school in Turkey which proved to be a great success and the final project handbooks have been a useful resource for parents and educators alike.
Project handbooks:
Learning for All - A Guide for Teachers
Learning for All - A Guide for Parents

projects.title: Lifelong Learning Leonardo da Vinci programme
projects.description: European Commission funded project with partners from Italy, Spain, Poland and Portugal focussed on training needs analysis for SMEs. This involved the transfer, improvement, updating of competences, methods and practices within the scope of the analysis of employees’ vocational needs. The final project result was a presentation to businesses in Krakow and a handbook “Best practices in vocational needs analysis of SMEs”.

authors.headline: Managing Director at La’Met Consultancy & AnotherView.Today

profile_positions.description:
Over fifteen years’ experience successfully completing over 3000 individual projects developing SMEs, education establishments and government departments covering training, coaching, designing, implementing and coordinating Research & Learning & Development.

Working internationally with innovative leaders of world-class organisations to realise and scale their visions for change. My responsibility was to manage multimillion budgets and represent the agency and provide leadership and motivation to a team of internal staff supporting and partnering with international business development. 

La'Met Consultancy / Another View is an international, multi-cultural, full-service research and development and learning development agency and concept creator supporting government, corporations, education, SMEs from diverse sectors with their learning & development, national and international.
profile_positions.title: Managing director at La’Met Consultancy & Another View

company.name: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Creator and lecturer of the Inclusive Entrepreneurship and Global Citizenship Course, researching a set of attitudes, competences and skills which allow people to turn their dreams into concrete projects or enterprises. Growing micro or small enterprises and social enterprises using business based approaches driven by a social mission including the analysis of the personal qualities required for successful entrepreneurship.

Part of the research covers researching Global citizenship and how it has evolved as, historically, human beings always have organized themselves into groups and communities based on shared identity. Such identity gets forged in response to a variety of human needs - economic, political, religious, and social.

All course students work in groups with the partner university students for one week in Romania. (Polytechnic University of Timisoara – www.upt.ro)  The object of the project trip is to share knowledge and compare and contrast the situations in The Netherlands and Romania when trying to set up a business with a financial and/or educational disadvantage and how the European Union inclusive entrepreneurship and global citizenship initiatives can help.
profile_positions.title: Independent and remote, Programme Creator, lecturer and student mentor

volunteer_experiences.description:
A society in which every child has friends and no handicapped child has to play alone - that is the ideal of the Dutch Foundation for the Handicapped Child.

Half of the disabled children have no friends or only 1 friend. 85% of disabled children have no friends around.

That so many children are lonely is not only sad; it also impairs their development. Because it is precisely by playing together, exercising and going to school that children learn important lessons for life.

No child without friends - that is what we are committed to every day. Every year we reach 30,000 children and ensure that they can grow up with peers. In the playground, at school, at the sports club.

Operating on the basis of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, COC has successfully devoted itself in the Netherlands to a greater measure of visibility, tolerance and recognition of lesbians and gays, and to information, acceptance, equal rights, pension rights, parenting options and AIDS prevention.
The Alzheimer Nederland Foundation has been committed to people with dementia and their loved ones since 1984.
